chapter.title: Sales Analysis (S/A) Module
chapter.para: This module enables you to analyze detailed sales information and generate reports using that information. Sales data may be sorted in several different ways--including by Customer, Item, Sales Representative, and Shipping Zone. The following Sales Analysis categories will be covered:

listitem.para: Sales history
Bookings
Summarized Sales history
Time-Phased Bookings
Time-Phased Sales history

section.title: S/A Reports
section.para: Reports for the module are stored here.

section.title:
sales history by customer
customers sales history for Sales History by Customer
section.para: To view Sales history by Customer, select the "Sales History by Customer" option. The following screen will appear:
When displaying Sales history by Customer, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Customer Number of the Customer whose Sales history you want to display.

The browse button located to the right of the field leads to a searchable Customers list. You may also access this list using the keyboard shortcut "CTRL + L". Once a Customer Number is entered, the Customer name and billing address will display. Select the "?" or "$" symbol next to the browse button to view Customer information for the specified Customer. If a Customer's credit is "In Good Standing," the button will feature a black question mark ("?") icon. If the icon turns to an orange dollar sign ("$"), the Customer's credit Status is "On Credit Warning." A red dollar sign ("$") indicates the Customer's credit Status is "On Credit Hold."
Select to display Sales history by Customer for all Product Categories.
Specify Product Category whose Sales history by Customer you want to display.
Enter a Product Category pattern to select a range of Product Categories.
Refine your search using Regular Expressions, as described in Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions"Topic: Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions".
Select to display Sales history by Customer for all Warehouses.
Specify Warehouse whose Sales history by Customer you want to display.
Sales history by Customer generated on or after this date will be displayed.
Sales history by Customer generated on or before this date will be displayed.
Select to include Costs in the display.
Select to include Prices in the display.
Display lists Sales history by Customer, using the specified parameters.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.
Select to generate the display, using the specified parameters.
Runs the report associated with this screen.

section.para: Right-clicking on an Order in the Sales history list enables you to select from the following menu options:

section.title:
sales history by bill-to name
bill-to names sales history for Sales History by Bill-To Name
section.para: The Bill-To Name for a Customer is defined as the Customer Name, as it appears on the Customer master. To view Sales history by Bill-To Name, select the "Sales History by Bill-To Name" option. The following screen will appear:
When displaying Sales history by Bill-To Name, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Specify the Bill-To Name for the Customer whose Sales history you want to view.

note.para: The "Bill-To Name" field on this screen supports Regular Expressions. For more information on pattern matching using Regular Expressions, see Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions"Topic: Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions".

listitem.para: Select to display Sales history by Bill-To Name for all Product Categories.
Specify Product Category whose Sales history by Bill-To Name you want to display.
Enter a Product Category pattern to select a range of Product Categories.
Refine your search using Regular Expressions, as described in Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions"Topic: Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions".
Select to display Sales history by Bill-To Name for all Warehouses.
Specify Warehouse whose Sales history by Bill-To Name you want to display.
Sales history by Bill-To Name generated on or after this date will be displayed.
Sales history by Bill-To Name generated on or before this date will be displayed.
Select to include Costs in the display.
Select to include Prices in the display.
Display lists Sales history by Bill-To Name, using the specified parameters.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.
Select to generate the display, using the specified parameters.
Runs the report associated with this screen.

section.para: Right-clicking on an Order in the Sales history list enables you to select from the following menu options:

section.title:
sales history by ship-to address
ship-to addresses sales history for Sales History by Ship-To
section.para: To view Sales history by Ship-To, select the "Sales History by Ship-To" option. The following screen will appear:

tip.para: This display returns results only for Sales Orders where a specific Ship-To Address number was entered on the Sales Order header. Data will not be displayed for Sales Orders where the COPY-TO feature was used.

section.para: When displaying Sales history by Ship-To, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Customer Number of the Customer whose Sales history by Ship-To you want to display.

The browse button located to the right of the field leads to a searchable Customers list. You may also access this list using the keyboard shortcut "CTRL + L". Once a Customer Number is entered, the Customer name and billing address will display. Select the "?" or "$" symbol next to the browse button to view Customer information for the specified Customer. If a Customer's credit is "In Good Standing," the button will feature a black question mark ("?") icon. If the icon turns to an orange dollar sign ("$"), the Customer's credit Status is "On Credit Warning." A red dollar sign ("$") indicates the Customer's credit Status is "On Credit Hold."
Enter the Ship-To Number of the Ship-To whose Sales history you want to display.
Select to display Sales history by Ship-To for all Warehouses.
Specify Warehouse whose Sales history by Ship-To you want to display.
Select to display Sales history by Ship-To for all Product Categories.
Specify Product Category whose Sales history by Ship-To you want to display.
Enter a Product Category pattern to select a range of Product Categories.
Refine your search using Regular Expressions, as described in Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions"Topic: Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions".
Sales history by Ship-To generated on or after this date will be displayed.
Sales history by Ship-To generated on or before this date will be displayed.
Select to include Costs in the display.
Select to include Prices in the display.
Display lists Sales history by Ship-To, using the specified parameters.

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.

section.title:
sales history summarized by customer by item
items sales history summarized by Summarized Sales History by Customer by Item
section.para: To view summarized Sales history by Customer by Item, select the "Summarized Sales History by Customer by Item" option. The following screen will appear:

mediaobject.caption: Summarized Sales History by Customer by Item

tip.para: From this screen, you can highlight a Line Item and then drag and drop it into a Sales Order using your mouse.

section.para: When displaying summarized Sales history by Customer by Item, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Customer Number of the Customer whose summarized Sales history by Item you want to display.

The browse button located to the right of the field leads to a searchable Customers list. You may also access this list using the keyboard shortcut "CTRL + L". Once a Customer Number is entered, the Customer name and billing address will display. Select the "?" or "$" symbol next to the browse button to view Customer information for the specified Customer. If a Customer's credit is "In Good Standing," the button will feature a black question mark ("?") icon. If the icon turns to an orange dollar sign ("$"), the Customer's credit Status is "On Credit Warning." A red dollar sign ("$") indicates the Customer's credit Status is "On Credit Hold."
Summarized Sales history by Customer by Item generated on or after this date will be displayed.
Summarized Sales history by Customer by Item generated on or before this date will be displayed.
Select to display summarized Sales history by Customer by Item for all Warehouses.
Specify Warehouse whose summarized Sales history by Customer by Item you want to display.
Order the output by one of the following methods:
Item Number: Select to order Items in display by Item Number.
Quantity Volume: Select to order Items in display by quantity volume.
Sales Volume: Select to order Items in display by sales volume.
Display lists summarized Sales history by Customer by Item, using the specified parameters.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.

listitem.para: Select to display time-phased Bookings by Item for all Warehouses.
Specify Warehouse whose time-phased Bookings by Item you want to display.

Select to display Inventory Units of Measure.
Select to display sales dollars.
Select the Calendar you want to use for the report.
Associated Calendar periods will be displayed.
Select as many periods as you want to display. Selected periods correspond to Calendar specified in the "Calendar" field.

Select individual periods or groups of periods together. To select an individual period, highlight the period using your mouse button. The period is now selected. To select a sequence of periods, highlight the first in the sequence using your mouse button. Then, holding down the SHIFT key on your keyboard, highlight the last period in the sequence. The entire sequence is now selected. To select periods that are out of sequence (e.g., January, April, July, October), highlight the first period in the group. Then, holding down the CTRL key on your keyboard, highlight the next period you want to select. Continue highlighting periods with the CTRL key depressed until all desired periods are selected. The entire group is now selected.
Display lists time-phased Bookings by Item, using the specified parameters.

section.title: calendars printing for sales analysis Print S/A Special Calendar Form

When printing a Sales Analysis special Calendar Form, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select the Calendar you want to use for the report.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without generating a report, returning you to the application desktop.
Runs the report associated with this screen.

section.title: Utilities
section.para: Utilities for the module are handled here.

section.title: Archive Sales History
section.para: If your system contains Sales history which is no longer required for Sales Analysis purposes, you may archive that history--effectively removing it from view. Archived Sales history may be restored to view at any point. To archive Sales history, select the "Archive Sales History" option. The following screen will appear:

note.para: Archiving Sales history does not delete Sales history. Rather, the historical data is simply relocated to a storage archive on the database. You may restore Sales history from the archive at any time.

section.para: When archiving Sales history, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select to archive Sales history for all Customer Types.
Specify Customer Type whose Sales history you want to archive.
Enter a Customer Type pattern to select a range of Customer Types.
Refine your search using Regular Expressions, as described in Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions"Topic: Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions".
Select to archive Sales history for all Product Categories.
Specify Product Category whose Sales history you want to archive.
Enter a Product Category pattern to select a range of Product Categories.
Refine your search using Regular Expressions, as described in Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions"Topic: Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions".

varlistentry.term: Archive Freight, Sales Tax and Misc. Items

listitem.para: Select to archive all the sales information which is not directly related to the Item Sites for a Sales Order--that is, Freight charges, Tax, etc.
Select to archive Sales history for all Warehouses.
Specify Warehouse whose Sales history you want to archive.
Sales history generated on or after this date will be archived.
Sales history by Shipping Zone by Item generated on or before this date will be archived.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without archiving Sales history, returning you to the application desktop.
Archives Sales History using the specified parameters.

section.title: Restore Sales History
section.para: If you have Sales history stored in an archive on the database, you may restore that history at any point. Restoring Sales history makes it available again for Sales Analysis purposes. To restore Sales history that has been archived, select the "Archive Sales History" option. The following screen will appear:

note.para: Archiving Sales history does not delete Sales history. Rather, the historical data is simply relocated to a storage archive on the database. You may restore Sales history from the archive at any time.

section.para: When restoring Sales history, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select to restore Sales history for all Customer Types.
Specify Customer Type whose Sales history you want to restore.
Enter a Customer Type pattern to select a range of Customer Types.
Refine your search using Regular Expressions, as described in Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions"Topic: Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions".
Select to restore Sales history for all Product Categories.
Specify Product Category whose Sales history you want to restore.
Enter a Product Category pattern to select a range of Product Categories.
Refine your search using Regular Expressions, as described in Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions"Topic: Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions".

varlistentry.term: Archive Freight, Sales Tax and Misc. Items

listitem.para: Select to restore all the sales information which is not directly related to the Item Sites for a Sales Order--that is, Freight charges, Tax, etc.
Select to restore Sales history for all Warehouses.
Specify Warehouse whose Sales history you want to restore.
Sales history generated on or after this date will be restored.
Sales history by Shipping Zone by Item generated on or before this date will be restored.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without restoring Sales history, returning you to the application desktop.
Restores Sales History using the specified parameters.
